Q: Why creating my own blog? ðŸ¤”
A: I want a place to record my learning and thoughts.
As someone who likes collecting and backing up, I always want to record the learning process and the challenges I encounter along the way. Plus, if it can help someone else, that would be even better. But it’s already 2024, and blogging seems a bit “retro.” Why not use other social platforms? One reason is passion and sentiment, which tech folks might understand haha. Another is the peace of mindâ€”writing down trivial notes without getting involved in the noise of social platforms.
Also, as someone who is a bit of a perfectionist (and not great at writing), starting a blog is always challenging: I’ve thought about it more than once, started a little, and then never continued. This time, I’m also “pushing” myself a bit. No matter what I write or how it turns out, Iâ€™ll just start. At least it’s recorded, and I can improve it later, right? Instead of always preparing, focusing on minor details, refining, refining, refining, and then giving up.
I remember a comic I saw some time ago [1], which is exactly the mindset I need to learn. Start with a prototype that works, then iterate!
title: My First Blog Post
